intro: Phialodiscus dewevrei, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many showy, often toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as forests and rocky outcrops. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
